Class Executive

  • java.lang.Object
    • Executive

  • public class Executive
extends java.lang.Object

    Executive

    The Executive class handles the main game logic. This class handles the menu interactions, keeping track of the state of the game, and determining a winner.

    Authors: Sean Cunningham, Samuel Gilchrist

    Sean's KUID: 2935773

    Sean's Email: s096c429@ku.edu

    Sam's KUID: 2886577

    Sam's Email: samofgil@ku.edu

      • helloWorld

        public void helloWorld()
        Prints "Hello World!" to the console

      • clearTerminal

        public void clearTerminal()
        Prints 50 newlines to the terminal to move any present text off screen.

      • letterToInt

        public int letterToInt(char col)
        Used to convert letters to ints, used when given coordinates in (A1-I9) form

        Parameters:
        col - The char input from the user representing a column on the board
        Returns:
        Returns the position of the char within the array coordinateLetters
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the char cannot be found within the coordinateLetters array, meaning that it is invalid input.

      • postMenu

        public void postMenu()
        Displays the menu in the console.

      • validateShipNum

        public boolean validateShipNum(int num)
        Validates that the input is an int from 1 to 5, inclusive.
        Parameters:
        num - The int to validate
        Returns:
        True if the value of num valid, otherwise returns false and prints a message to the console

      • safelyGetIntInput

        public int safelyGetIntInput()
        Requests an int from the user in the console until an int is successfully received This method handles errors that are thrown by Integer.parseInt()
        Returns:
        The int provided by the user

      • safelyGetCoordinates

        public java.lang.String safelyGetCoordinates()
        This method prompts the user for coordinates in the format A1 (LETTERNUMBER) This method handles bad input This method handles errors thrown by Integer.parseInt() and letterToInt()
        Returns:
        The String containing the coordinates specified by the user

      • run

        public void run()
        This method drives the central game logic and flow. This method sets up the game and handles each player's turns until the game ends.

      • playerWon

        public boolean playerWon(Board enemyBoard)
        This method determines whether a player has won the game. This is accomplished by checking every space on the enemy player's board, and if there are no remaining ships, then the game is over.
        Parameters:
        enemyBoard - An instance of the Board class containing the enemy player's data
        Returns:
        False if the enemy has any remaining unsunk ships; Otherwise returns true

      • placeShip

        public boolean placeShip(Board board,
                         int shipSize,
                         java.lang.String shipNumber)
        This method attempts to place a ship of size shipSize onto the provided Board object.
        Parameters:
        board - An instance of the Board class on which the ship will be pla ed
        shipSize - The size of the ship to place
        shipNumber - A word such as "first", "second", "third", etc... which describes to the user what number ship they are placing.
        Returns:
        True if the ship was successfully placed, false if the placement was impossible

      • getValidShipDirection

        public char getValidShipDirection()
        Prompts the user for a cardinal direction to orient their ship Continues to prompt the user until valid input is received.
        Returns:
        A char representing the valid user input for ship orientation
